SubSection.Title: Issues Overview
SubSection.Description: This section provides an overview of the issues uncovered during analysis. The report covers a summary of vulnerability categories discovered by the tool. The auditor should augment this section with higher-level conclusions derived from human review of the application (including architecture reviews, black-box testing, compliance issues, etc.)
SubSection.Text: On Feb 7, 2024, a source code review was performed over the WebGoat-2023.8 code base. 2,232 files, 29,188 LOC (Executable) were scanned and reviewed for defects that could lead to potential security vulnerabilities. A total of 660 reviewed findings were uncovered during the analysis.

SubSection.Title: Issue Summary by Fortify Priority Order
SubSection.Description: A table summarizing the number of issues found and the breakdown of issues in each Fortify Priority Level

SubSection.Title: Recommendations and Conclusions
SubSection.Description: This section gives some high-level recommendations on remediating the issues discussed in the Issues Summary sub section. Recommendations will vary based on deployment scenarios, risk appetite, and existing mitigating strategies. The auditor should supplement the Fortify generic recommendations with specific information that takes into account the application specific variables.
SubSection.Text: The Issues Category section provides Fortify recommendations for addressing issues at a generic level. The recommendations for specific fixes can be extrapolated from those generic recommendations by the development group.

SubSection.Title: Filter Set Summary
SubSection.Description: A brief summary of the filterset used to create this report
SubSection.Text:
Current Enabled Filter Set: Security Auditor View
Filter Set Details:
Folder Filters: If [fortify priority order] contains critical Then set folder to Critical If [fortify priority order] contains high Then set folder to High If [fortify priority order] contains medium Then set folder to Medium If [fortify priority order] contains low Then set folder to Low Visibility Filters:

SubSection.Title: Audit Guide Summary
SubSection.Description: Summary of the impact of the audit guide
SubSection.Text:
Code Quality Issues
Hide code quality issues. Poor code quality leads to unpredictable behavior, poor usability, and an opportunity for an attacker to stress the system in unexpected ways. AuditGuide can hide code quality issues if you are not concerned with them. Enable if you are not concerned with code quality issues.
Filters: If kingdom contains code quality Then hide issueSerialization Issues
Hide serialization issues. Incorrect serialization and de-serialization can lead to unpredictable behavior and cause denial of service attacks. AuditGuide can hide serialization issues if you are not concerned with them. Enable if you are not concerned with serialization issues.
Filters: If taint contains serialized Then hide issue If category is j2ee bad practices: non-serializable object stored in session Then hide issue If category is incorrect definition of serializable class Then hide issue If category is serializable class with no version id Then hide issueDenial of Service Attacks
Hide issues that are not directly security-related. Certain issues may lead to program crashes, but are unlikely to result in malicious code execution. AuditGuide can hide issues that are based on null pointer dereferences, uninitialized variables, double free bugs, and more. Enable if you are more concerned about security than reliability.
Filters: If category is use after free Then hide issue If category is double free Then hide issue If category is null dereference Then hide issue If category is uninitialized variable Then hide issue If category is missing check against null Then hide issuePoor Programming Style Issues
Hide poor programming style issues. Poor programming style usually results in confusing and buggy code. AuditGuide can hide poor programming style issues if you are not concerned with them. Enable if you are not concerned with poor programming style issues.
Filters: If category contains poor style Then hide issue

SubSection.Title: Vulnerability Examples by Category
SubSection.Description: Results summary for critical and high priority issues. Vulnerability examples are provided by category.

IssueListing.Refinement: [fortify priority order]:critical OR [fortify priority order]:high AND [fortify priority order]:medium AND [fortify priority order]:low

GroupingSection.groupTitle: Poor Error Handling: Overly Broad Throws
Cookie Security: Cookie not Sent Over SSL
Poor Logging Practice: Use of a System Output Stream
Poor Error Handling: Overly Broad Catch
J2EE Bad Practices: Leftover Debug Code
Poor Error Handling: Empty Catch Block
Password Management: Password in Configuration File
Code Correctness: Incorrect Serializable Method Signature
Dynamic Code Evaluation: Unsafe XStream Deserialization
HTML5: Overly Permissive Message Posting Policy
Spring Security Misconfiguration: Disabled Security Headers
